title: Lesson 86
paragraph: This lesson focuses on nature and existence, emphasizing organic, innate, and universal aspects.

words.meaning: related to living matter; natural and harmonious
words.example: The farm uses organic methods without chemicals.

words.meaning: based on instinct; natural and automatic
words.example: She had an instinctive reaction to protect the child.
Fear is a primal human emotion.

words.meaning: performed or occurring naturally without planning
words.example: They had a spontaneous celebration after the win.

words.meaning: existing as a natural or permanent quality
words.example: Curiosity is inherent in human nature.
She has an innate talent for music.

words.meaning: relating to the Earth or land
words.example: The terrestrial ecosystem includes forests and grasslands.

words.meaning: relating to the universe or cosmos
words.example: They studied cosmic phenomena like black holes.

words.meaning: applicable or common to all cases or people
